snippet: President Obama’s new military strategy has focused attention on weapons like mines and cyberattacks.
abstract: President Obama’s new military strategy focuses on the increasingly important threat of inexpensive weapons like mines and cyberattacks that aim not to defeat the American military in battle but to keep it at a distance; China and Iran are identified as countries exploring such ways to counter American military force.
lead_paragraph: President Obama’s new military strategy has focused attention on weapons like mines and cyberattacks.

headline.seo: Pentagon Tries to Counter Low-Cost but Potent Weapons
headline.main: Pentagon Tries to Counter Cheap, Potent Weapons
headline.print_headline: U.S. Focuses on Growing Threat as Rivals Deploy Cheap but Potent Weapons

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
